revised_title: Estimation of Time Taken for Impulses to Cross Synapses in the Spinal Cord of Frogs
tldr: The study investigates the time taken for an impulse to cross a synapse in the spinal cord of frogs. It measures the cord-delay in different reflexes and finds that the time taken is longer in crossed reflexes compared to same-side reflexes. The results suggest that there is one synapse in the conductive path for same-side reflexes and two synapses for crossed reflexes.
